name: Hyatt House Falls Church

reviews.title: Outstanding hotel, awesome stay!
reviews.text: Truly an awesome hotel, staff was very friendly and welcoming upon arrival and were very helpful if you wanted to find out tour information for visiting the area. The hotel is definitely brand new and the room was gorgeous. This hotel deserves more of a 4 star rating versus a 3 star. The food at the breakfast buffet was also very tasty and delicious. The amenities that this hotel offer are great as well. They have a nice fitness center and pool on the 2nd floor. I only was able to stay for 1 night but I will definitely be staying at this hotel again on my next visit to the DC area.
Warning: The hotel entrance can be a bit of a challenge to find because its not on the front of the street. Its on the side where the parking garage is located.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem in the DC Area

reviews.text: The area is very upscale, there are great restaurants located near by, along with a Target that is also close to the hotel as well. Overall excellent stay and will definitely be back again.
reviews.title: Nice!

reviews.text: Stayed here on business for one night, as they were offering a great rate using Priceline.
reviews.title: Wowza

reviews.text: Interesting place. Very modern and and Euro-looking. Located in an up-scale shopping area, which I will explore on the next trip. The place is brand new, so all of the fixtures, carpets, and furnishings were clean and new. Parking is in a modern covered garage adjacent to the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Property. Great Location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just stayed 3 nights at the Hyatt House and were pleasantly surprised. Check-in was easy and front desk was very helpful. There is plenty of free parking right across the street from the hotel and they provided free internet (both wired and wifi). I was very happy with the hotel and amenities especially considering we paid under eighty dollars per night. Since the hotel is geared towards long stays they also had LOTS of items you could borrow from the front desk (from blenders to board games) which was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great stay at a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had breakfast every morning and it was great. There were 4 kinds of bread items for toasting, made to order omlettes, eggs, donuts/pastries (switched on certain days), french toast/pancakes/waffles (rotated), cereal, yogurt, fruit, along with coffee, tea, and juices. It was a pretty nice spread for being included in the room rate!
reviews.title: Excellent new hotel in the Fairfax - Dunn Loring area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were also given a buy one get one 50% off for the restaurant (hours are 5pm-10pm) so we ate there one night. The food was good and not overpriced like you see at the big chains. With coupon we spend around $20 including tip and soda for two adults. There are also about 5 restaurants within a 3 minute walk and also a large Target and movie theater across the street.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, but a little inconvenient for visiting DC

reviews.text: The metro station to DC is about a 20 minute walk or 5 minute drive. However, they are building a parking deck that is not open yet so if you are there on a weekday you may not find parking (the garage looks like it might be done by in the next 2 months). We parked on the weekend and it was free although you had to walk around the fenced off parking garage. It's a 30 minute right into the Smithsonian stop.
reviews.title: Nicely new

reviews.text: I did have 2 very small complaints: once you turn on the road there is no hotel sign easily visible but it's probably due to shopping center restrictions so I drove past the hotel when checking in. The other is that there are signs that breakfast is only for overnight guests and we asked what the cost was if we wanted to meet a local friend and it was $20 per person. We thought that was a very high price so ate breakfast out with local friends the last day (there is an IHOP about 3 miles away).
reviews.title: Stay here, forget DC!

reviews.text: Stayed here with my husband and teenage daughter for a weekend. Weekend rates are very reasonable for the quality of property. I believe it was built in Nov 2012 so it still had that new feeling. We had a one bedroom suite with kitchen. Terrific gym with Life Fitness equipment. Pool area is lovely with attractive patio furniture.
reviews.title: Fantastic property, fabulous area

reviews.text: Included breakfast has a good assortment of hot items (sausages, waffles, eggs, potatoes) and the usual pastries, cereals, yogurt. There is an omelet bar where a chef will make your omelette to order. They were excellent.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and overall value in D.C. area

reviews.text: The beds were super comfortable bed and the room had lots of storage space. Nice big shower. Large vanity area outside of shower/toilet area helps with morning busy-ness.
reviews.title: Amazing quality and price for the area

reviews.text: The staff is extremely helpful and customer service oriented. Many restaurants and shops within walking distance. If you stay here, definitely try Four Sisters, an excellent Vietnamese restaurant a block away. It has a huge menu and we had a tough time deciding what to order.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location

reviews.text: Our stay here was an absolute pleasure and I highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Very nice find...and pleasant surprise near DC

reviews.text: Hyatt House Falls Church is in the new Mosaic District, a shopping/dining/entertainment area just opening in FallsChurch/Merrifield/McLean. The hotel is beautiful, spacious and connected. The breakfast was excellent with a chef preparing omelets and plenty of other hot and cold selections available for the morning. WiFi in the hotel is free and was pretty strong throughout my stay. I attended a conference on-site and found the meeting facilities and catering to be very good as well. Lots of dining options close by and just an all-around fine atmosphere. Rooms have full kitchens and plenty of dishes and utensils. Very comfortable stay.
reviews.title: Great find!

reviews.text: Overall the hotel was very well laid out and comfortable. I had a king studio that came complete with a small kitchen. Nice location it's in a new shopping complex with some cute stores and choices for dining menus from budget to mid priced items. There is a nice organic cafe a little pricey but the bread was really good right at the entrance of the hotel. The check in clerk was very welcoming and provided info about the hotel and bar. Upon getting off on the 6th floor noticed that the hall needed some housekeeping bits of paper here and there. The room itself was pretty clean but when I turned down the bed covers I noticed hairs all over the bed. The sheets and one pillow had an odor and it appeared that clean sheets had not been replaced from the previous occupant. It was very late at night and I did not want to move to another room so I slept on the side of the bed that did not appear to have been slept on. This was really disappointing for a Hyatt class hotel otherwise the room was wonderful. Upon check out there were two clerks at the front desk and when I approached the desk and said "Hello" I barely got a response from one of them. I handed over my key and there was no dialogue from them concerning my stay and to thank me for my business. I was very disappointed with the check out service. Being gold level status with Hyatt I prefer this brand and am usually happy but I have to say that being a new hotel as I believe they opened in Sep 2012-they should pay a little more attention to their housekeeping. I am going to write to the corporate office as well if I don't get a survey from them.
reviews.title: Comfortable but needs some attention

reviews.text: Residence Inn and Staybridge Suites watch out. This new kid on the block has done its homework and if this location is any indication of what they can do around the country, Hyatt Place has just upped the ante for the extended stay sector. This hotel itself is fairly new. The lobby is large comfortable and inviting. The rooms are large comfortable, well-appointed. And the rate we paid was very reasonable. The gratis breakfast was very strong, including an omelet station. The manager was clearly focused on customer service. Execution and training would be the only place where I would encourage improvement. I was double billed for one of my two rooms but quickly got that problem fixed. And the lady who ran the breakfast room must have gotten up on the wrong side of the bed. Hopefully that was a one-day experience, but I did encourage the manager to look into her lack of enthusiasm for customer service. I definitely would come back here again. This hotel was very convenient walking distance to a number of interesting business including a wonderful French bakery (Pastry Xpo). Nieman Marcus Last Call outlet and a first class Angelika Film Center. Parking is across the street on the second floor above the MOM's Organic Market parking, a little inconventient and poorly marked by the hotel.
reviews.title: Watch Out for this New Kid on the Block

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have been staying in a nearby (Sterling,VA) location and decided to give this new location a try. It is fairly close to DC, as close as you would get for this price. It is located right in the heart of the Mosiac District. Which includes Anthroplogie,Target (good for little items you need up needing),Mom's Market. There are a couple resturants in the area as well. Parking is located across the hotel in a new, modern parking garage (hotel customers use level 2). It is very well lit and safe. We stayed in a studio king room and loved it. It had a kitchenette in it that came equipped with everything you could need to make meals on your own. There was a nice size (32-36 I'm guessing) flat screen tv that swiveled for whatever angle you needed it on. It also had gaming outlets in case you want that sort of thing, which I would imagine would be a nice touch for kids. The windows crack open for fresh air, which we neeed since the main areas were super hot during our stay. They offer free internet along with wireless printing. It came in handy for us when we realized we wanted to go somewhere and needed directions and the address. They offer a 'borrow' menu, where if you forget something, they have it. the list was broad, ranging from curling irons to adapters for charging items. Beware, they do charge a $50 deposit that drops off when you check out and bring the items back. This is NOT stated on the borrows card. The main areas are so nicely decorated and there are little touches everywhere. One we liked in our room was the peephole cover (we are easily amused). The room was clean and smelled fresh. We got a view of the shopping area, which was a nice plus. The bathroom was good as well. We stayed for 3 nights and our maid cleaned the room like we were never there everyday (she got a nice tip!). They have a generous market pantry for items you need/forgot, including sandwiches and drinks. We bought a pop-up folding map of downtown DC, which came in VERY hand and I recommend! The workout area was clean and well lit, with enough machines to not have crowding. The business area was comfortable, although they did not have pen and paper there. You can ask the front desk for this. The lounge/bar area was nice. Well-lit in the day and ambient lighting in the evening. We had a soda and shared the cheese platter, which was delish. Breakfast here is amazing. Everything you could want. It did get a little crazy on the weekends, but they kept the plates and food coming. The switch up the hot meat options every day, which was a nice touch. they have ample, modern seating throughout the area. The fireplace was always on, which was a nice touch as well as it was cold outside and a nice place to have a coffee and warm up before heading out or retiring to your room. They also offer a pool table, which was fun and a nice way to wind down after a 5 hour drive. The pool/firepit area was closed for the season, which starts on Memorial Day. We were a bit disappointed as we were hoping to roast smores 9our own items) by the firepit. They also have the cushions to the seating put up, so there is no way to rest and get fresh air. All in all, this hotel is amazing. We have stayed in downtown DC hotels and payed almost triple of this hotel's cost, and it did not compare to this place! We also have stayed at 2 different Hyatt House locations, and they ALL are superb in quality. They front desk is always helpful, and nice. Check in and out were easy, fast and pleasant. I highly recommend this place!
reviews.title: Amazing quality!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a three day trip to see the cherry blossoms. When we made the reservation at the Hyatt House, the cherry blossoms were supposed to be in full bloom. Unfortunately, they were not. The lack of cherry blossoms did not dampen our enjoyment of the Hyatt House in Falls Church. Recently opened, the Hyatt House is a pleasure. The staff were all friendly and very willing to help. The room (king bed without a sofa bed) was large and well appointed. The free breakfast was typical of other Hyatt House facilities. In other words, it is very good. All of this at a very reasonable price of $93/night.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel/Location for exploring Washington, DC

description: HYATT house Falls Church is conveniently located in the Mosaic District. An outdoor mixture of unique gathering places with ample space, including areas for outdoor events, parks for performances and festivals, as well as a unique movie house. You’ll also find an eclectic mix of sophisticated retail and restaurants. HYATT house Falls Church offers a variety of rooms; standard rooms and suites with kitchens. All guests will enjoy our breakfast buffet daily, with made-to-order omelets, freshly brewed Starbucks coffee as well as a variety of fresh breakfast accompaniments.
